attributes.action: Make Children’s mental health training compulsory for all medical professionals.
attributes.additional_details: To help those children in crisis and to equip medical professionals in order to be able to compassionately provide care and treatment.
attributes.background: There is currently a mental health crisis among our children. CAMHS is stretched far beyond its means and hospital staff are not prepared to be able to deal with emergency situations. Make mental training a mandatory part of training.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about training for medical professionals are a matter for the NHS and relevant professional bodies, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
